abstract: Bridgewater Associates, the Connecticut money manager, announced in a filing that it was outsourcing its back-office operations to the bank.
snippet: Bridgewater Associates, the Connecticut money manager, announced in a filing that it was outsourcing its back-office operations to the bank.
lead_paragraph: Bridgewater Associates, the Connecticut hedge fund juggernaut founded by Ray Dalio, announced in a filing this week that it was outsourcing its back-office operations to Bank of New York Mellon. The 91 employees in the division will remain in Westport, where Bridgewater has its headquarters, but their paychecks will now bear the bank's name. Read more »

headline.main: Bank of New York Mellon Picks Up Bridgewater's Back Office
